page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Sturton-Le Steeple,Name origins. The name of Sturton-Le -Steele has some interesting origins.the old English version is Stret tun:the homesteadby the street.The street is the old Roman road from Lincoln to York.In 1086 the Domesday book records the name as Estretone and by the nineteenth century the name was Streton-en-le-Clay.It is not clear when the latter was dropped in favour of Le-Steeple.When later the fine parish church of St Peter and St Paul was built the tall pinnacled tower was a landmark for miles around.As well as the tower there are twelve fifteen foot smaller pinnacles on Sturton church.It is therefore possible that the origins go back to "En -le Steeple".
